a-new-park.description: Can you believe there was a park in Berkeley that we hadn't been to yet? This one's called John Hinkel, and has nice hiking.
a-new-park.title: A New Park

gym.description: Milo: "Look me, Papa!  Look me flip!"
gym.title: Gym

hand-me-down.description: This is a mega-hand-me-down.  Lucie wore this for the longest time when she was a kid. It was knitted by Babushka.
hand-me-down.title: Hand Me Down

homework.description: These are Felix's "homework" books -- mazes and puzzles and other games.  He pretends he's in kindergarden and the teacher's given him this as homework.
homework.title: Homework

indianrock1.description:
Felix ascends Indian Rock. Baby Dog brings up the rear, a little worse for wear.

Felix has real honest-to-goodness climbing harness. He and Dean have been practicing on weekends.
indianrock1.title: Indianrock 1

indianrock2.description: This was our reward for getting to the top of Indian Rock!  That's San Francisco across the bay.
indianrock2.title: Indianrock 2

milo2.description: Milo gets shy when Dean asks for a photo.
milo2.title: Milo 2

milo3.description: Contemplating the long distance to go until the local park.
milo3.title: Milo 3

milo5.description: Wondering when Dean's going to put away the darn camera and start walking to the park.
milo5.title: Milo 5

sanjose1.description: We went to San Jose to check out their Children's Museum.
sanjose1.title: Sanjose 1

sanjose2.description: Felix analyzes the currents by looking at leaves.
sanjose2.title: Sanjose 2

sanjose3.description: The children's museum felt expensive.  Downtown San Jose might be soulless, but it's not cashless.
sanjose3.title: Sanjose 3

sanjose4.description: The water play area had some of the coolest get-wet stuff we've seen. We got wet.
sanjose4.title: Sanjose 4

sanjose5.description: Do you see Felix in this picture?
sanjose5.title: Sanjose 5

sanjose6.description: It's hard to miss the museum from the outside.
sanjose6.title: Sanjose 6

sanjose7.description: San Jose: just the name makes you feel patriotic!
sanjose7.title: Sanjose 7

description:
Milo's adding grammar so fast that it feels like he's going to run out of new prepositions by Tuesday. From this week:
  • Mommy, I tell you, I want to get out. (Out of crib.)
  • I show you mess, Papa. (And indeed there was one.)
  • New window! You happy Mommy? I happy. I happy. (We got a new bathroom window.)

Lucie and Felix were at the grocery store. Lucie put a six pack of Corona in the basket and Felix shouted, "Oh my god, I love that beer!" Heads turned. It was a bit before Lucie realized Felix had a bottle cap collection in which Corona caps figure prominently.

Felix has been making amazing academic progress in the last two weeks. Read about it here.
title: November 19
